item.title: Howto: Connect to a Cisco VPN using Ubuntu Linux 10.04
item.description: Argh, I spent the whole day figuring out how to connect to the VPN of my current customer. The Windows client on my other computer works just fine, at least after selecting the UDP option. But it is quite some overhead to install Windows on my Linux box just to connect to a VPN. The proprietary Cisco VPN client for Linux works until kernel version 2.6.25 AFAIK. Therefore,Â this is no option for all users of Ubuntu 10.
